concept.title: Concept hierarchies
concept.shortdesc: Concept hierarchies organize the concepts that support a product or subject area, based on an analysis of the tasks that require them.

conbody.p: Concepts answer the question, "What is...?" They explain what something is and why it behaves the way it does. Use your task documentation to derive the list of concepts that require explanation. Ask yourself what background information users must understand before they can complete those tasks successfully. Some concepts may be too small to be appropriate as a concept, and may be adequately covered in your glossary. Others may not actually support user tasks: for example, background information on the architecture of a feature may be appropriate for a white paper, but not for supporting users of the feature.
A well-organized concept hierarchy can help users understand the model behind the product, which helps them choose the appropriate tasks for their high-level goals.
